medium: Silk, metallic threads, gold leaf; wrap resist dye, block printing
title: Woman's festival veil (Divali odhani)
text: On a moonless night in the month of <I>Kartik<I> (November-December), Hindu women throughout India light small oil lamps to commemorate an age-old victory of good over evil and to honor <I>Lakshmi<I>, goddess of good fortune. So begins the joyous festival of <I>Divali<I>. In times past, men and women in Rajasthan celebrated the holiday by wearing indigo-dyed cloth accented with gold, evoking <I>Divali<I> lamps glowing against a dark sky.
description: tie-dyed Mothra technique with gold leaf patterning, jewels, signed, very rare Royal India; three panels (one panel is two pieces) sewn together; tie-dyed diamond shapes with gold leaf designs at each diamond corner; black and white sheer; metallic petal sewn on two corners; two selvedges; two raw edges; lower edge:  embroidered numbers, \"836\" twice
creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons in memory of Roberta Grodberg Simmons
